content.description: Start up the giant shield leaning against the wall. make a couple moves off the top of the shield to the first bolt. Follow great pockets to a somewhat thin crux just after the last bolt. In true Scheuler fashion this route is equipped with "homemade" hangers; engineered, fabricated, and shaped locally in jefferson city. climb at your own risk.
content.location: Look for the giant shield of rock leaning against the wall.  About 40 yards climbers right of Deliverance.

content.description: 30 ft right of crack is the right line between 2 cedar trees. Slightly runout up white and black streaks on the wall. Tough for the grade.
Steep and tricky left dihedral. A couple face moves lead into the crack and insecure gear placements and position wait above.
content.protection: SR .3-4, Small wires, RPs. Bolt Anchor
content.location: Far left side of Bluff Two between Closing Time (11d) and an open project (Air Pork). This is the super obvious dihedral and a great looking line.

content.description: Gray rock starts into vertical white rock. Lead left then back right with crimps and a couple pockets that lead to a small overhang sloper crux, and slight runout to anchors.
content.location: A few routes climbers left of Crack of Dawn just around the corner; tree-shaded belay.

content.description: Next bluff North of Bluff One.
